DataElement.preferredName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events Hemorrhagic Cystitis Occurrence Noninfective Grade
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The grade of the common terminology criteria for adverse events noninfective hemorrhagic cystitis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events Hemorrhagic Cystitis Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.:Inflammation of the bladder resulting in bloody urine._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.

Concepts.longName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events
Concepts.definition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by inflammation of the bladder which is not caused by an infection of the urinary tract._A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Life-threatening consequences; urgent invasive intervention indicated
